description:
Role: Junior Web Developer




Role Overview:

A recent graduate with previous experience in the digital marketing realm as it pertains to search engine optimization, content marketing, and/or website development. The ideal candidate will have basic knowledge of Web Development best practices, as well as a working knowledge of Google Webmaster tools, current CMS platforms, and page builders. Your primary focus will be working with the digital marketing team to ensure all aspects of software design and coding are met.




About Pinckney:




Founded in 2011, Pinckney Marketing is a strategic marketing agency that builds full-funnel campaigns designed to generate traffic, convert leads and drive revenue from marketing to sales. Headquartered in Charlotte, NC, our agency serves clients across the U.S. in various industries such as: technology, healthcare, financial, manufacturing, and many other professional services.




Pinckney Marketing is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or any other basis protected by law. Employment at Pinckney Marketing is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications.




Our Marketing team is committed to making a true difference by providing real value and measurable results. We strive to help companies grow and achieve their most ambitious sales and marketing goals through client-centered solutions.

Role Responsibilities:

Basic Web development strategies and implement on both the frontend / backend
Performing keyword, competitor and industry research for a variety of clients
Assisting the Web Developer to improve website functionality
Awareness of best practices in Web Development and business/industry trends for each client
Monitoring the technical performance of accounts
Reporting on data analytics for internal and external purposes
Figure out how to best scale, secure, maintain, and extend current client needs

Qualifications:

Previous digital marketing internship and/or relevant experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Computer Science, or related field (Preferred)
Knowledge of website analytics tools, including Google Webmaster tools, CMS platforms, HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Experience with Google analytics and knowledge of how to track performance
Analytical thinker with the ability to brainstorm new ideas autonomously and with a team
Exceptional communication skills, both one-on-one and across all levels of management




Expected Salary:

$45,000-$65,000




Pinckney Perks

Comprehensive Health Benefits
Retirement Planning & Profit Sharing
Education Assistance
Annual Bonus Eligibility
Team Building Outings
Community Outreach & Involvement

The Lukens Company (TLC) is an award-winning full-service marketing agency that is seeking a Web Developer & Designer to join our Creative Department in Arlington, VA (permanent remote is also being considered). Staffed by awesome people looking to make a difference in the world, the Creative Department creates engaging dire response designs to support the fundraising and marketing efforts of nonprofits, cultural institutions, advocacy groups, and faith-based organizations.




What you’ll be doing

Working with teammates to deliver web development and design deliverables on time, within budget, and to a standard of quality expected by ourselves and clients
Advising project managers on best technical practices
Developing and designing landing pages, lightboxes, ecommerce forms, email templates, microsites, and websites
Performing quality assurance checks and troubleshooting




What we'd like to see

Bachelor's degree or other formal training (experience at an agency or nonprofit preferred)
Effective communication skills
Self-starter with a demonstrated capability to manage multiple projects, prioritize a variety of tasks, and think on your feet to meet ever-changing needs and deadlines
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with quick turnarounds
Proficient in Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator
Ability to code HTML and CSS
Experience with WordPress (knowledge of GitHub and JavaScript is a plus)
Adept at problem solving and resolving conflicts
Results-oriented and team-first attitude
Inclination to learn and grow professionally
Desire to work for a values-driven company that seeks to improve the world for the better




What we offer

Competitive compensation
401(k) with match
Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurances
Flexible PTO and generous holiday observances
Learning and professional development opportunities
Paid parental leave
Company-sponsored volunteering
Remote work
Collaborative and entrepreneurial work environment
The opportunity to be part of a friendly, dynamic, and hardworking team excited about delivering high-quality work and great results for our clients




About us

The Lukens Company (TLC) is an award-winning full-service marketing agency that provides expert direct response, donor development, and fundraising services to nonprofits, cultural institutions, advocacy groups, and faith-based organizations. Since our founding in 1986, our passionate team of creatives have partnered with cause-oriented organizations seeking innovative, data-driven strategies to achieve bold goals that change the world for the better. Our 35+ years of experience across a diverse client base enables us to deliver unique, compelling multichannel campaigns that captivate audiences and yield transformative results… all while being delivered with an unparalleled commitment to our clients’ missions. Join us!




The Lukens Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

job_title: Back End Web Developer - ArcGIS StoryMaps
description:
Overview

Join our team and build next generation web applications used by millions! You will work to design, build, and run the cloud infrastructure and backend services powering this system, including APIs and data pipelines. We are looking for a highly self-motivated individual with experience developing cloud applications and data pipelines who values automation, testing, and security.

Responsibilities

Design and implement micro-services based backend services
Design and implement public and internal APIs
Design real-time and batch data pipelines
Build cloud infrastructure (Azure/AWS)

Requirements

1+ year of experience developing cloud infrastructure, backend services, and data pipelines
Solid understanding of JavaScript, NodeJS, and/or Python
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
Experience testing cross-browser, cross-platform, and/or cross-device compatibility for inconsistencies
Extreme attention to detail
Working knowledge of all UI/UX stages, such as conceptual, user flows, UI prototypes, HTML/CSS coding, and specs delivery to developers
Bachelor's in computer science or computer engineering, or equivalent (master's or PhD a plus)

Recommended Qualifications

Familiarity with a server-side rendering of web components, preferably Next.js/React.js
Experience delivering product features in a consumer or enterprise company
Experience with AWS: Lambda, ELB, RDS/MongoDB/Redis
Experience implementing clean unit tests and integration tests

Questions about our interview process?

About Esri

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.

Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.

Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email askcareers@esri.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address.

Job Title: Web Developer

Location: Denver, CO

Estimated Duration: Through 2022 with high likelihood to extend or convert

Key responsibilities

Develop web applications to visualize and provide insights into large volumes of location-enabled event data.

Participate in software development lifecycle from requirements gathering to planning long-term support. Be willing to collaborate with non-technical stakeholders, development operations staff, data scientists, and software architects.

job_title: IT Web Developer, Community and Portal
description:
Description

Automation Anywhere is a global leader in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), empowering customers to automate business processes with intelligent software bots – AI-powered, digital workers that perform repetitive and manual tasks, resulting in dramatic productivity gains, optimized customer experience, and more engaged employees. The company offers the world's only cloud-native, web-based intelligent automation platform combining RPA, artificial intelligence, machine learning and analytics. Automation Anywhere has deployed nearly 3 million bots to support some of the world's largest enterprises across all industries in more than 90 countries. For more information about our portfolio, please visit us at www.automationanywhere.com.

Our Opportunity

This position is within the IT team and creates long-term value by leading projects across web platforms based on requirements from marketing and sales team stakeholders. The ideal candidate will bring experience working within Salesforce® communities to create digital customer and partner experiences as well as a senior web development technical skill set. Proven delivery capability and the ability to drive internal bug and enhancement work to completion will be key to success in this role. This role will lead the build of a brand new B2B business portal using salesforce communities, as well as supporting our current custom built B2B business application.

Location: Remote role - ability to work within any U.S time zone

You Will Make An Impact By Being Responsible For

Working with business analysts and cross-functional stakeholders to solution and create brand new business systems within salesforce community's platform.
Serving as the technical owner of the Salesforce.com® customer and partner portals (build using salesforce communities).
Working with business analysts to translate business requirements into development user stories, building out technical tasks for offshore developers to execute against.
Collaborating with other technical team members to understand, design, and develop brand new digital experiences for AAI customers & partners using industry best practices.
Supporting business stakeholders by following proper defect ticket triage and SLAs.
Providing technical guidance to US and India based developers and ensure proper communication of technical user stories, applicable system dependencies, and overall build requirements.
Collaborating with Enterprise Architects to ensure all recommended solutions and technical user stories meet AAI best practices and security standards.
Continually increasing both business and technical knowledge to deliver technology-based solutions that are aligned with our business strategies.

You Will Be a Great Fit If You Have

7+ years’ experience using modern Content Management System such as Cascade Server, Drupal, Joomla, and WordPress. Experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, XHTML and/or other web development tools.
5+ years’ SFDC Community development experience with proven understanding of Salesforce administration and user support tasks
com certification a plus
Experience in SFDC Lightning platform
Experience in Community Licenses function and distribution (a must), including self-registration
Experience in building knowledge Articles (design, functionality, strategy) with Customer, Support Communities

You Excel In These Key Competencies

Understanding of Salesforce.com platform and products
Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with technology team, users and key stakeholders, displaying effective communication and good judgement across different levels and types of interaction
Experience working in a fast-paced, startup environment desired.

Why Automation Anywhere?

At our company each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.

As the leader in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), we provide a very compelling product where our teams are breaking new ground every day and given an environment to grow their skills and have fun along the way. Our technology is the game changer, and our people give us the edge to better our world and go be great!

All unsolicited resumes submitted to any @automationanywhere.com email address, whether submitted by an individual or by an agency, will not be eligible for an agency fee.

job_title: Full Stack Software Engineer / Programmer / Web Developer - (Fully Remote)
Front End Shopify Web Developer (Remote Position)
description:
Posted by

Arianne Foulks

Captain & Founder at Aeolidia | Designing Shopify sites for artisan/designer businesses.

You’re a Great Fit For Our Team If:

You can commit to working 15-20 hours per week, and are interested in growing in the role.
You have a reliable internet connection which allows you to work from anywhere.
You’re a front-end developer with at least three (3) years of Shopify ecommerce experience.
You have WordPress experience as well, and can ensure one seamless-looking site between the two software programs.
You know how to code a website from a Figma or Sketch file, PSD file, AI file, or Zeplin. Really, really well.
You use best responsive practices, including using JavaScript/jQuery, icon fonts, and SVG graphics.
You know what makes a user-friendly, high-converting ecommerce experience.
You are experienced using Git to push commits to a remote repository like Bitbucket or Github.
You have a comprehensive understanding of theme sections and section blocks.
You know the difference between a section and a snippet and which one is appropriate for your use case.
You write well organized, well indented, and commented code that is easily read by other developers.
You are comfortable using JavaScript / jQuery libraries and writing custom functions.
You are familiar with and know how to use structured data and JSON-LD.
You are a skilled communicator who works one-on-one with clients.
You are able to express yourself clearly and cheerfully to non-technical people over email, video, and phone.
You are skilled at giving clear tutorials and walk-through trainings.
You are punctual to an extreme.
You are excited to keep growing and learning best practices and new technologies.
You’re not someone who settles for the status quo. You continuously look for ways to improve and streamline our processes.

Juno Diagnostics is a young startup in the women's healthcare space. We are building a platform that enables women to have easy and affordable access to prenatal care.

Juno is reimagining the way medical information is communicated to the patient and we are building a platform to make this goal a reality. We have a team of world leading experts that can deliver the pregnancy relevant content. We are now looking for a highly creative and flexible front-end web developer with an expertise in React and React technologies, who can put this vision into code. You are a developer with a strong sense of visual design when coding and your solutions are responsive and work across tablet and mobile platforms.

We are moving quickly and are very focused on execution. In this position you will have frequent communication with the team, but also the option of working remote. If you are the right fit, we are happy to relocate you to sunny San Diego to come work with us. The team over here at Juno is very experienced and we are looking to bring people on that can be as passionate about our mission as we are.




You should bring:

7+ years of experience in web development, including client-side Javascript development
Expertise in React and React technologies such as Redux and React Router
Expert in various CSS systems including SCSS (Experience with Tailwind CSS a strong plus)
Familiar with token-based access control systems and understanding REST client development
Candidate should be familiar with Next.js and how to construct server-side rendered React pages




Other things that make you special (not required but great if you have it)

Server-side Node development
Experience integration React with A/B test tools and web analytics systems like Google Analytics
Experience with PWA technologies and use of mobile hardware resources like camera and local storage

job_title: Front End Engineer - Amazon Forecast (AWS AI)
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Imagine never needing to hop from store to store during holidays because your first stop can anticipate the demand for the products they carry and stock up accordingly.

Imagine never having to wait too long or pay too much because your favorite ride-hailing service can account for weather or local events and direct enough drivers to your area.

Amazon Forecast is a fully managed AWS AI service that uses machine learning to help companies achieve these goals by delivering highly accurate forecasts.

Our engineers and scientists continuously innovate so that our customers can keep up with the speed and scale of their business operations without the data science background or machine learning experience needed for generating highly accurate forecasts.

As a front-end engineer on the Amazon Forecast team, you will:

work closely with UX designers, product managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions.
build greenfield user experiences by incorporating diverse user requirements (e.g., accessibility, internationalization), user hardware constraints, and front-end security risks.
improve and enhance the user experience for the customers of AWS AI services using latest front-end technologies.

You will use modern web-development tools and techniques including TypeScript, Node, React, Redux, CI/CD pipelines, Grunt, Webpack/Babel, Mocha/Jasmine/Jest, HTTP/2, and Git.

Key job responsibilities

Work closely with UX designers, product managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions.
Build greenfield user experiences by incorporating diverse user requirements (e.g., accessibility, internationalization), user hardware constraints, and front-end security risks.
Improve and enhance the user experience for the customers of AWS AI services using latest front-end technologies.

A day in the life

You will use modern web-development tools and techniques including TypeScript, Node, React, Redux, CI/CD pipelines, Grunt, Webpack/Babel, Mocha/Jasmine/Jest, HTTP/2, and Git.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

About The Team

Amazon Forecast is a fully managed AWS AI service that uses machine learning to help companies achieve these goals by delivering highly accurate forecasts.

Our engineers and scientists continuously innovate so that our customers can keep up with the speed and scale of their business operations without the data science background or machine learning experience needed for generating highly accurate forecasts.


Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.
2+ years of professional front-end development
Experience with modern programming languages (JavaScript, C#, or Python) and open-source technologies.
Skilled with common front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JS, TypeScript, Node, React

Preferred Qualifications

Experience building tools for data scientists or developers.
Attuned design sense so can collaborate with UX designers and hold a high bar with “backend” SDE's.
Experience with with CI/CD in a frontend context.
Experience establishing and leveraging web analytics.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.
hands-on technical expertise in full-stack development.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A1975215

Posted by

David O' Gorman

Senior Manager, Talent Acquisition at Environmental Defense Fund

Send InMail

Overall Function




Reporting to the Director of Online Fundraising and Advocacy, and working collaboratively with the Membership and Online Marketing teams, the Web Developer is responsible for innovating and developing dynamic web and email-based member engagement digital products to support Membership’s multi-channel fundraising and advocacy programs across our three main brands: EDF, EDF Action and EDF Action PAC.




The role will focus mainly on managing web development projects — but will also require a collaborative approach to follow and support backend data management needs across multiple systems. This would include ensuring sourcing and other key business rules are maintained in a consistent and organized way to:




Support robust data privacy/security standards.
Feed analytics and reporting systems.
Support the needs of other data management and segmentation end users.




Key Responsibilities




Serve as primary developer for web and email-based Membership campaigns. This involves working with Membership’s five main platforms: Adestra, Classy, Phone2Action, Personify, and Mobilize
Develop dynamic and interactive web/form components
Help maintain brand consistency across Membership platforms
Maintain dynamic email templates and develop conditionalized message blocks
Collaberate with Webteam in building cross-platform/site fundraising, advocacy and cultivation experiences
Serve as immediate support to internal form producers/editors
Serve as primary contact point with platform account reps and platform support teams regarding technical issues and data questions
Develop automated testing to ensure integrity of key campaign forms
Understand data flows and API integrations between Adestra, Classy, Phone2Action, Personify, Mobilize as well as following and supporting data integration business rules to and from other data platforms, i.e. Salesforce, Snowflake, BlueVenn, etc.
As needed, support third party integrations and data appends
Participate in advancing EDF DEI goals in which people from all backgrounds and experiences feel connected, included, and empowered to address the environmental and organizational challenges in alignment with EDF values




Qualifications




Ideal candidates are well versed in front-end web development and can navigate multiple platforms in the data ecosystem with special focus on:
Javascript
SASS / CSS
Gulp, Rollup (build processes in general)
Site building
Email building
Experience interacting with APIs
Git
Familiarity with:
NodeJS
SQL
Front-end frameworks like Angular, React and Vue
Specialized education with two years’ experience or at least three years’ experience working as web developer with a strong background in setting up and managing dynamic digital campaigns and the data management skills needed to support integration and analytical needs.
Both the technical skills required for the job and the ability to communicate effectively with non-technical marketing staff.
An understanding of the entire web development process, including design, development and deployment, with some back-end knowledge.
Work with the wider team to maintain graphic standards and branding throughout the development process.
Keen eye for design and UX/UI. Bonus if you have experience creating design and UX/UI assets to implement.
An enthusiastic, flexible, problem-solving approach with a keen debugger’s mind to anticipate and respond to evolving requirements and technical glitches as they arise.
A demonstrated ability to multitask, project manage and prioritize multiple requests. And a willingness to work with a broader team to maintain, follow and as needed develop clear business rules to ensure data integrity and consistency across multiple platforms and with multiple collaborators.
Ideally, the strongest candidates will also have a demonstrated understanding of standard constituent engagement strategies to recruit supporters, keep them inspired and engaged and ultimately to become long-term supporters of EDF’s core mission. In other words, the candidate must have a strong understanding of UI, cross-browser compatibility, general web functions and standards to develop compelling digital experiences.
An outlook that reflects EDF’s core values of Optimism, Integrity, Innovation, Respect and Results. And being comfortable working with a geographically dispersed team, using email, Slack, phone and virtual meetings to stay connected.
Demonstrates self-awareness, cultural competency and inclusivity, and ability to work with colleagues and stakeholders across diverse cultures and backgrounds.




Environmental Defense Fund is an equal opportunity employer where an applicant's qualifications are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Who We Are

Ever wonder who brings the entertainment to your flights? Panasonic Avionics Corporation is #1 in the industry for delivering inflight products such as movies, games, WiFi, and now Bluetooth headphone connectivity!

How exciting would it be to be a part of the innovation that goes into creating technology that delights millions of people in an industry that’s here to stay! With our company’s history spanning over 40 years, you will have stability, career growth opportunities, and will work with the brightest minds in the industry. And we are committed to a diverse and inclusive culture that will help our organization thrive! We seek diversity in many areas such as background, culture, gender, ways of thinking, skills and more. If you want to learn more about us visit us at www.panasonic.aero . And for a full listing of open job opportunities go to www.panasonic.aero/join-us/ .

The Position

The Frontend IT Web Developer will be responsible for designing and delivering business critical web-based applications for enterprise clients using latest Front-End technologies such as but not limited to JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Node…etc. This role has responsibility for understanding client business and technical requirements and delivering appropriate end-to-end solutions. The developer will work with BSAs and other developers to ensure successful development of solutions that meet our customer's needs.

Works independently and simultaneously manage multiple assignments. Work in an efficient manner resulting in low defect, high quality software that fulfills the specified business requirements. Confer with management and personnel of other departments to implement projects.
Provides an ongoing maintenance and support for applications within the area of responsibility and provides production support.
Designs, develops and deliver technical solutions to business requirements.
Has experience to resolve moderately complex issues in creative and effective mechanisms.
Develops appropriate documentation for architectural, design, technical, implementation and test activities
Remains current with emerging Front-End Web technologies. Presents subjects/issues clearly to technical and non-technical audiences. Provides regular communication to management on programming assignment issues and status.
Communicates and reports issues, status, and results to management with recommended solution.
Adheres to standards ,controls and conducts quality assurance over programs before migration to production
Delivers assignments according to a schedule.
Analyzes applications and makes necessary changes to optimize performance.
Other duties as required to support and meet the needs of Panasonic Avionics Corporation.

What We Are Looking For

Expert knowledge of JavaScript, modern JavaScript libraries and tooling.
Expert knowledge of HTML, CSS, and related web technologies.
Expert knowledge of using CSS pre-proceeding techniques such Sass and Less.
Expert knowledge of using task runners and CSS compilers such as Webpack, Grunt.
Expert knowledge of consuming Web APIs.
Familiar with Visual Studio IDE.
Good knowledge of UX and HCI.
Working knowledge of WordPress development.
Working knowledge of at least one of JavaScript framework such as Angular or react.js.
Familiarity with Docker containers.
Good working knowledge of source control such as TFS, git.
Awareness of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations.
Bachelors or master’s degree in computer science, or related experience.
HCI degree or UX is a plus.
8+ years solid working experience as a front-end developer.
Analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Experience working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Experience working with source code control, production control and issue tracking systems is plus.

Our Principles

Contribution to Society | Fairness & Honesty | Cooperation & Team Spirit | Untiring Effort for Improvement | Courtesy & Humility | Adaptability | Gratitude

What We Offer

At Panasonic Avionics Corporation we realize the most important aspects in leading our industry are the bright minds behind everything we do. We are proud to offer our employees a highly competitive, comprehensive and flexible benefits program.

We offer flexible remote work options depending on your role. Where possible, we offer fully remote or hybrid work opportunities.
Paid time off: Exempt Salaried employees receive unlimited PTO. This means that there is no fixed number, range, or limit to the amount of Personal and Vacation Days that may be taken for exempt employees. Non-exempt hourly employees accrue 14 vacation days per year + 7 sick days + 3 personal days. Accrual rate increases with tenure. All employees receive 11 company paid holidays per year plus a paid company-wide shut down in the U.S. between Christmas and New Year.
Health Insurance: Medical insurance offerings from Aetna and Kaiser (CA &HI). Options for Employee Only, Employee + Spouse/Domestic Partner, Employee + Children, or Family. Dental PPO and DMO options & Vision insurance through EyeMed or VSP.
401K with 50% match on up to 8% contribution, full vested from day 1
Other offerings include: Wellness Program, Counseling services, FSA & HSA, Life Insurance for employee, spouse and child, AD&D Insurance, Long-term and Short-term disability, Critical Illness Insurance, Accident Insurance, Legal Assistance, Pet Insurance, Identity Theft Protection, Dependent Care FLSA, Education Assistance, Commuter Program, Employee Purchase Program, Service Award Program.

All applicants are subject to Company policies, third party customer and worksite requirements, and government requirements, regarding vaccination and/or testing for COVID-19. Where permitted by applicable law, applicants may be required to be fully vaccinated with an authorized COVID-19 vaccine as a condition of employment, unless they are eligible for and obtain an exemption based on a reasonable accommodation because of a disability or a sincerely held religious belief, practice, or observance. While the Company strongly encourages COVID-19 vaccinations, it may require vaccination and/or testing for positions in which third party customer, worksite, or government requirements apply, in accordance with applicable law. At those locations where requirements apply, exemptions will be considered based on applicable law.

Panasonic is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law or company policy. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Pre-employment drug testing is required for safety sensitive positions or as may otherwise be required by contract or law. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Avionics Corporation.

Posted by

Stephanie T. Garner, MA

Talent Acquisition Partner II at Carhartt

Send InMail

Position Details

Location: Dearborn, MI

Reports to: Manager of D2C Digital UX

Department: D2C/Marketing

Status: Exempt

Job Band: Professional




Summary

The Web Optimization Developer will be responsible for establishing an ongoing optimization testing program and creating a structured process for AB/MV testing, creating success metrics for experiences, and reporting results to stakeholders and leadership. You will be the subject matter expert for session recreation tools and will harness personalization tools to assist in optimization. In this role you will work closely with the Carhartt Data team to identify issues, consumer friction points and understand the impact on key KPI’s. The ideal candidate for this role is experienced at analyzing and interpreting data, adept at working with cross functional teams, and can write accessible and reusable code to create experiences that streamline consumer journeys and remove barriers to task completion. You will also be responsible for identifying and resolving ADA compliance issues to meet WCAG standards.




We are All Leaders at Carhartt




In our words and by our actions, we strive to emulate the hardworking example set forth by our founder, Hamilton Carhartt. We Lead Business by creating value, delivering on results, and making changes along the way. We Lead Self by being dependable, because hardworking people count on us to have their back every day. We Lead Others by communicating and clearly defining the path as we walk bravely into the future. Working at Carhartt, we are all given a seat at the table and the honor of continuing the legacy.




Responsibilities

Continuously evaluate the website to identify friction points.

Partner with the Carhartt Data team to utilize and analyze user journeys to find issues adversely affecting KPIs.

Create and maintain a testing calendar for optimizations.

Communicate the objectives of testing, along with success metrics to leadership.

Coordinate and collaborate with SMEs and leaders in data, marketing, integrated media, creative, and merchandising to ensure the teams collectively deliver ONE premium customer experience across business initiatives and execution projects.

Act as end-user advocate and ensure balanced decisions are made.

Act as a project manager for optimization efforts. Manage project plan, health and progress reporting.

Write ADA compliant code utilizing HTML, CSS, and Javascript.

Identify and resolve accessibility issues on the site.

Provide project estimates with reasonable accuracy then independently execute against projects within speciﬁed deadlines.

Create dashboards and reports on optimization efforts, including performance to KPI targets.

Actively participate in team SCRUM’s and proactively identify risks and solutions.

Assist the team with coding day-to-day site changes as the need arises.

Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent years of experience required

Required Skills And Experience

3+ years of professional experience developing digital ecommerce experiences.

1+ years of experience using web analytics and an A/B testing platform such as Adobe Test & Target, Optimizly, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or Quantum Metric.

Experience operating in or running a successful web optimization testing program.

Experience gathering testing requirements from cross functional partners.

Experience with a session recreation tool is a plus.

Familiarity with User Experience design best practices.

Knowledge of WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards and the ability to write compliant code.

A proven track-record of learning and playing with new technologies.

Passionate user advocate who can spot opportunities among the ‘noise’ of information and who can bring those opportunities to life on the site.

Ability to develop and drive execution of strategies, tactics, measurable implementation plans across channels.

Excellent organizational, analytical, communication and interpersonal skills, including a strong commitment to follow-up, follow-through, collaborate with cross-functional teams and a sense of urgency.

Ability to meet timelines and, when needed, work under deadlines while maintaining strong attention to detail and quality of your work.

Intellectual curiosity with an appetite for change.

Portfolio with representative professional, polished website development work and samples of website development projects.

Working Conditions

Remote or In-Office
Travel (5%)
Tobacco Free

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s agricultural supply chain business, where we seamlessly connect farming customers with food, feed and industry.

Job Purpose and Impact

The Quantitative Trade Execution Front-End Engineer will develop and maintain the analytical capabilities, trade identification, risk evaluation and trade entry systems, processes and interfaces. In this role, you will provide advanced knowledge and thought leadership in the development of trading opportunities through analysis and access of execution. You will provide leadership to foster and develop quantitative resources in assigned business functions.

Key Accountabilities

Create information and report to our internal and external customers and ensure the accuracy of our positions and data by maintaining an effective control process.
Use quantitative skills and system knowledge to create solutions for various roadblocks.
Evaluate and integrate external systems or software for the business and develop a talent pipeline to support the technical capabilities.
Create and maintain portfolio profiles and risk analysis and develop analysis for trade opportunities.
Identify and execute trade opportunities in the assigned book to add value and provide guidance on the most effective hedging possibilities for different structures.
Provide expert thought leadership in your field and work with limited direction, using additional research and interpretation to identify issues or problems. You may provide direction to supporting team members and be a strategic contributor.
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Confirmed experience or knowledge combining financial markets, coding, system development and financial product settlement
Minimum of six years of related work experience

Preferred Qualifications

Master's degree or other post-secondary degree in a quantitative discipline
Confirmed experience in developing and maintaining financial position inventory systems
Confirmed experience in multiple programming languages

Cargill highly encourages vaccinations but does not mandate at this time. Upon hire, you will be asked to provide your vaccination status, and if unvaccinated or if you choose not to disclose, you would be expected to follow Cargill’s safety protocols for unvaccinated employees (i.e., mask mandates, and social distancing).

Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.

As a Web Developer for a DTC public company, you will be motivated every day to combine the art of design with the art of programming. You will be responsible for all client-side logic including the development, integration, and enhancement of multiple web applications. You will also be bridging the gap between the visual elements and the server-side infrastructure, taking an active role on both sides, and defining how the application looks and functions. You must be comfortable working as part of a team while taking the initiative to take lead on new innovations and projects.

Responsibilities

Design and develop new user-facing features
Build high-quality, reusable code and libraries for future use that adhere to industry best practices
Work closely with design resources to ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs while maintaining user-centric focus
Optimize applications for maximum speed, scalability and SEO
Assess, evaluate, and recommend new software to help achieve business goals
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders




Qualifications

2+ years of web development experience.
Shopify liquid development and theming experience.
HTML5, CSS, Javascript, Ajax experience
Apache Server, PHP, MySQL knowledge
Strong understanding of responsive web design, UI cross browser compatibility, general web functions and standards.
Optimization of on-page elements, information architecture and server technology for SEO, performance and security.
Ability to code involved, web layouts and custom interface components from planning to implementation.
Familiarity with hosting environments, DNS, SSL certificates.
Solid understanding of underlying web technologies.
Experience working with Apache web server including URL redirect/rewrite.
Experience with E-Commerce platforms, shopping cart and payment gateways

Joshua Woodard 2nd

CEO of AcreValue & Ag-Analytics

We seek energetic, high-quality full-stack web developers to join our growing team at AcreValue. AcreValue is the premier land tech platform in agriculture.

Minimum 2-3 years experience building production software. Proficiency in AWS/Linux/Python/JavaScript/React/Angular and related technologies, plus industrial DevOps experience, is most relevant. Posted by

Emily Ambrose

Director of Strategic Growth and Culture at Energy Circle LLC

A Mission-Driven, Culture-Forward Company

Energy Circle is the marketing and communications pioneer at the forefront of the built environment transition. For over 12 years, we’ve been on a mission to accelerate the transformation of homes and buildings towards reduced carbon, renewable generation, greater energy efficiency, health and comfort. Our unique expertise is in growth support and lead generation for high performance contractors committed to a building science approach as well as manufacturers launching cutting edge building products. We also serve nonprofits and associations on the front lines of solving the climate change impact of buildings.

As a culture, we’re an anti-agency agency: a small, flat organization where you’ll be encouraged to maintain work-life balance and have fun along the way. You will report directly to our Director of Web Development and collaborate daily with the entire Energy Circle team. We strive with verve and enthusiasm to apply best-in-class, innovative digital marketing strategies and tactics to move the needle on big picture sustainability efforts.

The Position

The Web Developer position builds high performance websites using Energy Circle’s (EC’s) Drupal/ WordPress distribution. This position includes site building, theming, content migration, and responsive CSS coding. You’ll work with our in-house development team, information architects, digital marketing strategists, graphic designers, and content strategists to build responsive sites with best-in-class conversion optimization and exceptional UI design. In addition to client site building, the role will also be relied upon to support the EC team with general technical expertise, specific projects such as integrating third party API’s, the development of new features and functionality within the EC marketing platform, technical troubleshooting, and maintenance of existing sites. We’re a committed open source shop working primarily in Drupal and WordPress.




This is a mid-level position and you should have:

2-3 years work experience in web development - building/ developing websites in Drupal & WordPress
Bachelor's Degree in a technical discipline or equivalent experience
Experience in advanced site building in Drupal 7
Strong HTML / CSS skills
Experienced with Version Control (git), SCSS, jQuery
Familiarity with command line & its tools - Composer, Drush, WP-CLI
Familiarity with various server environments - and understanding of FTP / SFTP / SSH
Excellent collaboration skills and enthusiasm for the web development process
Outstanding communication skills, including the ability to present technical concepts to non-technical clients




In an ideal world, you’d also have:

Experience implementing external libraries, JavaScript
Experience creating themes from scratch for Drupal/ WordPress
Experience working with and implementing 3rd party API integrations
Server and Database management / maintenance experience - Pantheon a big plus!
Other CMS platforms are a plus (Wix, Squarespace, Shopify etc.)
Experience working in an agency




What you’ll get in return:

A competitive salary
On-the-job training and mentoring
10 paid vacation and holiday days per year
Summer Fridays
WFH hybrid and remote-work options
401(k) with employer matching contribution
Unlimited PTO
Healthcare coverage with option for dental and vision coverage
Downtown Portland, dog-friendly office
Zero tolerance for assholes!

Front End Engineer

Location: Flexible

Reports to: Director

Start Date: Immediately

About QOMPLX

Developer of enterprise operating system designed to support the development and management of decision platforms in virtually any business domain. The company's system delivers customers advanced detection and monitoring, adaptive response, and risk optimization capabilities against advanced attackers, enabling clients to quickly and easily integrate all of the disparate data sources across the enterprise into a unified analytics infrastructure to make better decisions.

We pride ourselves on integrity, humility, resourcefulness, collaboration, and our ability to tackle the world’s most demanding problems. We are looking for exceptional talent to help us grow.

If this type of environment sounds exciting, we encourage you to look in detail at the job summary below. If there is a strong fit, please reach out to us directly via application at https://www.qomplx.com/careers/.

Job Summary

The Front End Engineer will design and develop user-centric experiences using the latest web technologies in partnership with Full Stack & Back End Scala Engineers. QOMPLX’s web applications are written in Vue.js and make extensive use of current tools such as Vuetify, , Webpack and and NPM. You will be responsible for identifying and leveraging the best open-source libraries and writing additional custom JavaScript libraries or library extensions when required. Specific development will range over a variety of tasks, from core user interactions and account management to managing near real-time and batch-oriented data processing for analytics and simulation modeling.

Responsibilities

Develop state-of-the-art analytics tools and contribute to key user interactions and interfaces for tools
Develop functionality to improve the ease of use of algorithms and data science tools
Improve visualizations of network security states, challenges, and opportunities
Work collaboratively to ensure consistent and performant approaches for the entire user experience and for analytic code developed inside the system

Bachelor's Degree or 8 years of relevant work experience
2+ years overall experience with responsive and single-page web applications
2+ years of experience in use of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
1+ years of experience with data visualization
Experience with VueJS, Material, Sass, Webpack
Experience with agile development
Familiarity with npm, git.


Desirable:

Experience with Typescript
Specific knowledge of d3.js, sigma.js, and other advanced JavaScript-based visualization libraries
Knowledge of information security, insurance, risk management or finance applications
Knowledge of BEM CSS naming conventions
Experience with other popular web frameworks like React.
Thorough familiarity with ES6
Familiarity with nginx, Docker & Kubernetes


Compensation & Benefits

Competitive salary
Full range of benefits, including 401(k) and medical, dental & vision coverage
Flexible “Personal Time Off (PTO)” plan and 10+ paid holiday days per year


Contact Us

Apply for this role at https://www.qomplx.com/careers/
Please include a cover letter and your current resume with all inquiries

job_title: Front-End WordPress Web Developer - Fully Remote (U.S. only)
description:
Posted by

Emily Nyaz, PMP

We're Hiring! Founder and CEO at HUSL Digital

Our Agency

HUSL Digital is a strategic digital agency specializing in delivering high-value results for high-growth companies and organizations. We partner with our clients to create and implement digital solutions that have an immediate and lasting impact.




We believe investing in People delivers the highest returns.
We believe Partnerships encourage success.
We believe in building and implementing a flexible, repeatable Process.
We believe all work, big and small, should be done with Purpose.




Our team of strategists, project managers, designers, developers, and marketers are fully distributed across the globe. Client accounts are led by Client Success Managers focused on delivering high-quality work in a fast-paced environment. Our full-time team enjoys a flexible PTO policy and 17 paid holidays along with comprehensive health, vision, and dental benefits plus short and long-term disability and 401k employer matching up to 4%.




Job Description

We are looking for a mid-level Front-End WordPress Developer. In this role, you will work primarily in a client-facing capacity under the guidance of your Client Success Managers and our VP of Technology. As a Developer at HUSL Digital, you’ll be working as part of a passionate team to strategize, problem-solve, and implement the visual designs handed off by our creative team.




Reporting to our VP of Technology, you’ll work with our Client Success Managers to act as a Front-End WordPress developer across several client accounts, both maintenance and full builds.




You will also be expected to maintain well organized projects, clearly document technical processes, research emerging technologies, work with clients to strategize, and work with our development team to improve processes and approach.




Your daily schedule will consist of a quick team meeting in the morning to review the items on your schedule for the day. You will spend the remainder of your day working through those items which may consist of one-off tasks for existing clients, working on various layouts as part of a new website build, or the occasional meeting with a client to discuss project work.




Work is 100% remote. Annual salary of $50,000 - $65,000 (DOE).




Requirements




U.S.-based
3+ years of professional experience with Web Development
2+ years of experience developing with PHP and WordPress
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal)
Strong frontend development skills, and pixel-perfect CSS
Ability to work with design comps and follow the specifications that have been outlined
Demonstrated expertise in responsive HTML5, CSS/animations, SASS, JavaScript and jQuery
Clear understanding of GIT branching, merging and rebasing; familiarity with GIT-flow
Knowledgeable in mobile responsive CSS, and optimizing for different devices and browsers
Excellent analytical skills to innovate ideas with our team and troubleshoot issues for our clients
Excellent written documentation
An overall positive attitude, with a passion for coding and taking pride in your work




Bonus

Gutenberg experience
Experience using Figma, Sketch, Zeplin or Adobe XD
Ability to estimate time needed for completing tasks




The Perks




100% remote work
Health, dental, vision, life insurance
Schedule is standard business hours, M-F
Flexible PTO policy
17 paid company holidays
401k with up to 4% company match

When you’re the best, we’re the best. We instill an environment where employees feel engaged, satisfied and able to contribute their unique skills and talents. We provide extensive opportunities for personal and professional development, building both employee competence and organizational capability to fuel exceptional performance now and in the future.

Apexus is the nation’s leader in creating reliable health care solutions by enhancing access to medications and improving patient care. We achieve these outcomes through innovative ambulatory pharmacy solutions and support of compliant 340B programs. In addition to serving as the HRSA-designated Prime Vendor for the 340B Drug Pricing Program, Apexus offers professional training and validation through its Advanced 340B Operations Certificate Program and the Apexus Covered Entity Refund Service (CRS) to streamline ineligible 340B discount refunds and Acentrus, a health system-centered solution for local, integrated specialty pharmacy care. For more information about Apexus, visit www.apexus.com.

Summary

In this role, you will work collaboratively with the Apexus digital marketing team to improve UX/UI of digital platforms, including optimization of HTML and CSS of multiple consumer facing websites. You will work directly with digital marketing to identify and prioritize opportunities to improve existing applications and add additional functionality to improve user experience.

Responsibilities

Develop, code, test, enhance, and debug website code; build page development on multiple corporate websites and creates innovative digital marketing vehicles that increase the engagement of outside audiences.
Partner with digital team colleagues, back-end developers and network support on the development of web solutions and external pages for corporate campaigns and websites
Display platform expertise with systems and digital concepts, ensuring the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs and optimizing applications for maximum speed, scalability, and accessibility.
Assist the digital marketing team with email campaign functionality, developing HTML code for mobile responsive emails and templates.
Participate and collaborate in cross functional teams to design and develop web solutions for campaign specific messaging.
Keep abreast of latest technology advances and their potential application for the company.
Provide technical expertise and advice for assignments and/or projects.

Qualifications

Relevant degree preferred. Web Design or Development, Marketing, Business Administration or Computer Science preferred.
2 or more years’ experience required.
Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3, client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery, cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them, and Bootstrap and various CMS applications.
Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS
Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them.
High sense of responsibility and urgency to execute strategic initiatives.
The ability to function effectively and efficiently in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

#IDS

Estimated Hiring Range

$68,500.00 - $99,400.00

This position is also incentive eligible.

Posted by

Erin Oltersdorf 2nd

Recruiting Manager for Campus Advantage | Connecting the best talent to the best team in student housing

Send InMail

What’s the job?

The Dashboard/Web Developer role centers around our client websites and the digital components of our integrated marketing campaigns, as well as our reporting dashboards and lead attribution process. This role is critical because it serves up the touchpoints where our clients’ prospects become leads and ultimately convert to business. Our developers are aware of how the marketing process works and have targeted their skills toward supporting the marketing process.

Klipfolio is the dashboard tool Catalyst uses. It collects KPIs and data from a multitude of different sources (SEM, SMM, SEO, and others) and aggregates it into one easy to access location. A thorough and extensive knowledge of data collection and how to utilize it is essential. This consists of: Understanding how the data is processed and organized into the dashboard, the ability to interpret it meaningfully as it pertains to the client’s business objectives, and to communicate this effectively and coherently. Additionally, APIs and querying systems knowledge is a must, particularly as they relate to dashboard development and usage.

From a macro perspective, the breakdown of the role is about 80% data structuring and analysis and 20% front-end design/development.

Websites

From time to time, this role acts in a supporting capacity for our group of web developers. As such, the ability to jump into a website and build it out, make minor updates, and help with digital campaigns is a necessary component. This requires proficiency with HTML, CSS, JavaScript/jQuery, WordPress, WordPress themes, and responsive design. It is helpful to have an eye for modern design, a mindset for user experience, and the capability to produce high-quality content in a fast-paced environment.

We offer our clients both template and custom options, always built out on the WordPress platform. We are also developing our own development framework in the near future.

Our sites are initially built with on-page SEO, mobile responsiveness, page speed, and other factors Google requires, and are designed to accommodate an ongoing SEO program. Additional skills in UX/UI design, analytics, and other digital marketing services are required.

Workflow

Project management:

• Demonstrate an ability to organize workload and workflow

• Effectively plan and organize your day-to-day priorities – handling multiple projects efficiently, effectively, and productively

• Prepare thorough, accurate, and consistent work to clients reflective of the agency’s standards

• Be able to adapt to workload and working conditions while maintaining a positive attitude and professional demeanor




Dashboards:

· Maintain dashboards and data, ensuring accuracy of information and client functionality

· Review data for benchmark performance and communicate this with the Account Team

· Further develop and create dashboards to match the needs of the agency and its clientele




Communication

Day-to-day communications:

• Communicate clearly and accurately on project statuses and deadlines and deliver accordingly

• Ability to create efficient workflows, bulk process repeated/routine workflows, and set boundaries on your calendar to stay focused

• Ability to work directly with Account and Interactive Teams

Presentation skills:

• Ability to work directly with clients to present work and functionality

• Contribute openly regarding recommendations, research, strategies, and efficiencies in client meetings and internal brainstorms

• Report on campaign metrics and provide strategic recommendations

• Good understanding of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager as well as data visualization







Innovation & Knowledge

Marketing Innovation & Knowledge:

• Proficiency in WordPress CMS including the WYSIWYG editor interface as well as the PHP structure, the loop, and preferred plugins such as Gravity Forms

• Strong layout and JavaScript troubleshooting skills using Chrome or Firefox developer tools

• Proficiency in web markup including HTML5 and CSS3

• Basic understanding of CSS pre-processors such as LESS and SASS

• Proficiency in client-side JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery

• Proficiency in responsive design/mobile first concepts and principles

• Working knowledge of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX

• Working knowledge of Linux distributions and shell/command line environments

• Good understanding of cross-browser compatibility with efficient troubleshooting skills

• Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them

• Proficiency in landing page best practices

Catalyst Innovation & Knowledge:

• In depth understanding of Catalyst, our history, our beliefs and our direction – confident with presenting agency credentials and case studies to clients, prospects and third parties

• Advocates for new services, corporate marketing, other ideas to promote Catalyst’s brand presence and visibility with client and potential clients

And…

Surprise and delight:

• Contribution to client and agency above and beyond including cultural stimulus and out of hours entertaining

• New business development when appropriate/possible

• Demonstrate a commitment to the agency that goes beyond the remit of own immediate clients/team

job_title: Front End Engineer - Innovate on a New Platform in AWS
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Do you want to innovate on a new platform with Amazon Web Services?

Come join our teams in AWS, you’ll help us design and develop solutions that enables AWS to expand our operations into new data centers worldwide. As an AWS Front End Engineer (FEE), you’ll be a hands-on coder and contribute to the design of applications with a team of engineers. We’re building new platforms from the ground-up, you get to build green-field projects in AWS.

To succeed in this role, you believe in high standards for code quality, code reviews, testing, and operational excellence. You support your peers to deliver results in a space that operates much like a start-up, with the autonomy to build the right solution from Day One. As a FEE with our team, you will collaborate with other engineers on technical direction, strategy with a career opportunity for growth that AWS can offer.

Our solutions will support programs in sustainability and compliance, and build a platform that will extend to first-class AWS services. You’ll join our team in AWS Security Assurance, collaborating with engineers designing solutions at massive scale.

This role is located in Arlington (VA), New York City (NY) or Boston (MA).

Remote Work Options Available

We value your time to innovate and recognize the need for heads down time to focus on a build. We also value in-person collaboration and time spent face-to-face. Our team affords engineers with options to work in the office every day or work remotely in a flexible hybrid schedule.

About Us

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Basic Qualifications

BS degree and 3+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
Strong understanding of algorithms, data structures, databases, and problem solving

Preferred Qualifications

TypeScript and/or Javascript
Experience with serverless computing, enterprise-wide systems, and AWS products
Experience working successfully with partner teams at remote locations
Understanding of Agile software engineering practices

description:

Firm Information

Reed Smith is a global relationship law firm with more than 1,700 lawyers in 27 offices throughout the United States, Europe, Asia and the Middle East.

Founded in 1877, the firm represents leading international businesses, from Fortune 100 corporations to mid-market and emerging enterprises. Its lawyers provide litigation and other dispute resolution services in multi-jurisdictional and other high-stakes matters; deliver regulatory counsel; and execute the full range of strategic domestic and cross-border transactions. Reed Smith is a preeminent advisor to industries including financial services, life sciences, health care, advertising, entertainment and media, shipping and transport, energy and natural resources, real estate, manufacturing, technology, and education. For more information, visit reedsmith.com.

Additionally, access to our U.S. offices will be limited to personnel who are fully vaccinated from COVID-19. If you believe that you require an accommodation to this policy because of a medical, religious or other reason,please let us know at the time of your interview so that a reasonable accommodation can be discussed.

Position Summary

As a Web Developer you will work as part of the Development Team to enhance, maintain and modernize the firm’s proprietary portfolio of custom applications, intranet, extranet and data visualization initiatives. The ideal candidate will have advanced web development skills and a keen understanding of modern UI/UX . This person will be responsible for helping Reed Smith develop and maintain custom systems, data integrations and reports in support of various legal practice groups, staff departments and system integration efforts (both legal specific products and large enterprise systems). The Web Developer must possess the skill-sets necessary to hit the ground running. You must be comfortable independently working projects from conception through maintenance and have a desire to learn about legal industry specific technologies while solving problems quickly.

The Onshape business unit is a fast-moving start-up-like environment within the greater PTC organization. We are creating the next generation of engineering software TODAY and are building an exceptional team of marketing professionals to help bring it to market.

The Onshape Marketing team is seeking an experienced Full Stack Web Developer to join our Digital UX team. You will be responsible for various aspects of www.onshape.com including implementing and maintaining our Vue web forms; leveraging our headless CMS to build out personalization and digital experiments; using API’s to connect to our various business systems (video, marketing automation, Google Analytics, Oauth, search, etc); collaborating with our development team to create a seamless integration with the Onshape product, and creating a best-in-class user experience for our prospects and customers.

The ideal candidate will need to be creative, agile, and flexible as we innovate in the SaaS B2B and Engineering software fields. We are seeking someone who wants to roll up their sleeves and get to work; and someone who isn’t afraid to experiment, fail fast, and try again.

You will work with a small team of UX designers and Back-End developers as part of a larger marketing organization. Your work will have a direct impact on the experience of our customers and our bottom line.




Required Skills / Qualifications

2-5 year’s experience in web development
Expert-level knowledge of Javascript
Familiarity with NodeJS
Expert-level knowledge of Google Analytics
Intermediate level knowledge of Automated Testing
Intermediate level experience with content management systems (CMS)
Familiarity with HTML / CSS

Typescript
Statistics
Google Cloud Services or AWS
Jira & Confluence
Headless CMS / API driven CMS (We use Crownpeak)
Command-line
Git / Github
Gulp
Linting tools

🌎 About Us

At TeamSnap, we believe when the world connects through sports; the world becomes better. TeamSnap is a sports and communication platform dedicated to taking the work out of play in youth sports. We also believe our jobs should excite us, our teammates should support us and our bosses should inspire us. We empower our people to bring big ideas and tiny egos, landing us on Outside Magazine’s list of “Best Places to Work '' and Built In’s “100 Best Remote-First Places to Work”.




TeamSnap is seeking a Mid-Level Software Engineer - Full Stack interested in working across the stack to join our fully distributed engineering team to help us continue our impressive growth from 23 million customers to beyond! Our stack includes Ruby/Rails, Go, Elixir, and SQL along with Typescript, React.

Similar roles include: Software Engineer / Developer, Fullstack Engineer / Developer.




Our engineers collaborate on technical challenges that enable them to learn new skills and grow their careers (article here). From a recent hackathon, we released the first-in-industry health check screening for teams. This led us to win the 2021 Big Innovation Award!




To deepen our connections with each other, we collaborate in pair sessions, virtual team swarms, and asynchronously within Slack. We also love to travel to fun locations across the country for all-company gatherings, team meetings, and the like.




What You'll Do:

Build engaging new commerce and partnership integrations and experiences for our customers
Implement scalable apps and services, integrating these into an evolving unified product and system architecture
Brainstorm and evaluating new product features in collaboration with the product team.
Work as a member of a team to collaborate on work, overcome obstacles, and deliver high quality software




What Will Set You Up for Success:

Desire to gain experience working on projects for web apps and services at scale
Experience in fullstack development building experiences with Ruby, Go or Elixir, and Typescript/Javascript utilizing React. Familiarity with other languages and frameworks as well
Developing skills in the areas of SQL and relational databases such as MySQL along with migrations, profiling, and optimization of such databases
Integration experience with developer APIs, plugins, event streams, webhooks, etc. as you’ll be creating similar
Marketplace, platform, ecommerce or partnership experience a plus
Ability to jump in to debug and fix problems that may span a number of systems
A sense of humor… or at least sympathy-laugh at our bad jokes




Got cold feet? If you’re thinking you don’t meet 100% of the above qualifications, you should still seriously consider applying. We’re all humans with special talents that go beyond what’s listed here.




Compensation

We’re committed to equitable compensation for all TeamSnappers. The minimum starting point for this role is $109,000, inclusive of base and bonus, with comp updated based on multiple factors. Our comp is highly competitive in our space and we adjust overall comp based on relevant experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location.




🖥 Location

TeamSnap is a fully remote company, so you need to be very comfortable working with people who aren’t in the same time zone as you. We are always expanding, but there is a small list of states we do not hire in at the moment, including Alabama, Alaska, Delaware, District of Columbia, Hawaii, Iowa, Louisiana, Mississippi, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Mexico, Rhode Island, South Carolina, and South Dakota and while we love all parts of the world, we can only hire permanent US residents at this time.




🚀 Opportunities to Grow

At TeamSnap, you're not a culture fit, you're a culture add. We work hard to provide a culture of trust, accountability, inclusivity, and boundless opportunities to grow, along with the chance to make a lasting impact and have some fun while doing it.




🎩 Total Rewards

We're proud to be remote-first. We've been working remotely since 2009, long before COVID made it cool
Unlimited PTO and paid parental leave for ALL parents (not just primary or secondary)
100% premium coverage of medical/dental/vision for you and your family
401K to help you invest for the future
$1,500 annual learning and development stipend
Travel to fun locations for all-company meetings and team events
Generous home office allowance to set you up for success
TeamSnap Swag to keep you looking sharp
Monthly stipend for health & wellness and much more!




🧡 Inclusion and Diversity

Creativity and innovation can't thrive when we're cookie-cutter images of each other. We’re quickly growing more diverse, but there's always room for improvement. We are committed to inclusion and diversity at TeamSnap and this includes four employee resource groups: Women, People of Color, LGBTQIA+, and the Talent Acquisition Task Force, designed to reduce unconscious biases in our hiring practices. We hold ourselves accountable in building an environment where everyone feels valued. If you need any disability-related adaptation during the recruitment process, just let us know! We are an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.
